parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "spack",
  "details": {
    "scheduler": "slurm",
    "scheduler_module": "slurm",
    "spack_version": "0.17.3",
    "spack_instance": "gpu",
    "spack_instance_version": "b",
    "spack_instance_dir": "/cm/shared/apps/spack/0.17.3/gpu/b",
    "spack_package": "nvhpc@21.9",
    "spack_compiler": "gcc@8.5.0",
    "spack_variants": "+blas +lapack +mpi",
    "spack_spec": "nvhpc@21.9 % gcc@8.5.0 +blas +lapack +mpi",
    "resource_requirements": {
      "nodes": 1,
      "tasks_per_node": 1,
      "cpus_per_task": 16,
      "memory": "93G",
      "gpus": 1,
      "time": "01:00:00"
    }
  }
}
```

This script runs `spack`, a package manager for scientific software, to install the `nvhpc` (NVIDIA HPC) compiler version 21.9. It uses `slurm` as a scheduler, and the script requests 1 node, 1 task per node, 16 CPUs per task, 93 GB of memory, and 1 GPU.
